title: Debunking Leslie London misconceptions : Anti - Semitism and Zionism on campus – The Mail & Guardian
message:
(Photo by MAGALI COHEN/Hans Lucas/AFP via Getty Images)Apparently, if you believe Leslie London’s article in the Mail & Guardian, Jews lie.
Let’s start: London’s suggestion that Zionist Jewish students are feeling uncomfortable on campus, because they are being challenged to think differently about Israel is laughable.
The reason Jews on campus feel uncomfortable is they are being made to feel so.
We felt helpless when we watched students and faculty physically block Jewish students from entering parts of the campus we share, or even when they turned their faces away in silence.
And yes, these anti-Zionists did include Jewish students, just as the apartheid system included black people who were willing to collaborate with it.

title: Chicago delegation joins American Zionists at the Global Conference for Israel
message:
A delegation of philanthropists from Chicago at Jewish National Fund-USA's 2022 Conference Courtesy of Jewish National Fund-USAA delegation from Chicago will join thousands of American Zionists at the Global Conference for Israel for a weekend filled with camaraderie, inspiration, and speakers who exemplify Israel’s positive contributions to the world.
“Our world changed on Oct. 7, but if anything, we have become more resolute and more united as a people as we work to build a stronger Israel,” said Chicago-based Conference Co-Chair Deb Zaluda.
The 2024 conference will once again welcome thousands of pro-Israel supporters and hundreds of students at the event’s high school and college summits.
Several discounted rates are available for Jewish Communal Professionals and young philanthropists, ages 22-40.
For more information or registration, visit jnf.org/global, email conference@jnf.org, or call (800) JNF-0099.

title: Violent Clash at Los Angeles Synagogue Condemned by Officials
message:
ANTI-SEMITISM - A violent clash erupted on Sunday between pro-Palestinian demonstrators and supporters of Israel outside the Adas Torah synagogue in the Pico-Robertson neighborhood of Los Angeles.
The incident has drawn condemnation from several high-profile figures, including President Joe Biden, California Governor Gavin Newsom, and Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass.
She added, "I want to be clear that Los Angeles will not be a harbor for antisemitism and violence.
"Targeting a synagogue, or targeting the members of a synagogue, is anti-Semitic," said U.S. Representative Ted Lieu.
The incident underscores the ongoing tensions and the need for continued vigilance against acts of hatred and violence in Los Angeles and beyond.

title: Town hall held on Staten Island to address  stark meteoric rise of antisemitism
message:
STATEN ISLAND, N.Y. — As Americans witness a rise in antisemitism at home and abroad, Jewish community leaders found it important to hold a town hall-style discussion Monday night at the Jewish Community Center (JCC) in Sea View.
Sponsored by the Council of Jewish Organizations Staten Island (COJO) and featuring guest speaker Josh Kramer, director of the American Jewish Committee New York, several dozen people gathered at the Joan & Alan Bernikow Center.
Dozens gathered at the Jewish Community Center in Sea View for a town hall to address antisemitism on Monday, June 24, 2024.
“The stark meteoric rise of antisemitism over the course of the last year has been disorienting for the Jewish community to say the least,” Kramer said.
Joe Silver of New Jersey said he felt it important to attend because he’s very concerned about real issues in regard to threats against the Jewish community and Jewish students.
